intro: Valerianella truncata, commonly known as garden valerian or false sorrel, is a flowering plant in the family Caprifoliaceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 cm and thrives in moist, shady environments. It is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. Valerianella truncata is known for its aromatic foliage, which has been used historically in herbal remedies.
